alert.note: Alert for Loup Rivers Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 1:58PM CDT until April 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING... ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING IN PORTIONS OF CENTRAL, NORTH CENTRAL AND THE EASTERN NEBRASKA SANDHILLS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 209... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT SATURDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 209... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Saturday for fire weather zone 209. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 209 Loup Rivers Basin. * TIMING...From 1 PM CT (Noon MT) through 8 PM CT (7 PM MT) Friday and from noon CT through 8 PM CT Saturday. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph Friday. South 10 to 20 MPH with gusts to 30 MPH Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent Friday and around 20 percent Saturday. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower to middle 60s Friday and lower 70s for Saturday. * IMPACTS...Any fires which may develop, have a high probability for rapid spread and will be difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
